title: MD
biography: Kazi Nazrul Islam was an Indian Bengali poet short story writer, journalist, lyricist and musician. He was later honored with the title of national poet of Bangladesh. Nazrul produced a large body of poetry, music, messages, novels, and stories with themes, that included equality, justice, anti-imperialism, humanity, rebellion against oppression and religious devotion. Nazrul Islam's activism for political and social justice as well as writing a poem titled as "Bidrohī", meaning "the rebel" in Bengali, earned him the title of "Bidrohī Kôbi". His compositions form the avant-garde music genre of Nazrul Gīti.
aiSummary: Nazrul Islam is a pulmonology specialist with an H-index of 65 at National Institute of Diseases of the Chest (Member). Has been published in The Science of The Total Environment, Composites Part A Applied Science and Manufacturing, The Lancet. Based in Unknown, Unknown, Global.
